intro: Astragalus wiedemannianus subsp. brachypterus, commonly known as the short-stalked milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The subspecies is distinguished by its shorter stipules and reduced flower structure compared to other Astragalus species. It typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. This plant is of interest in botanical studies due to its unique morphological features and ecological significance.
